TopicTitle: Forked MechJeb 2.3.0.0 with Terminal Velocity fix for FAR 0.14.0.2

Articles.Content:
After wanting to have a fix for the ascent guidance in MechJeb when using FAR, I decided make a quickfix myself and I though I would share it with you!

This will only work with FAR 0.14.0.2!!!

Link removed

Replace your GameData/MechJeb2/Plugins/MechJeb2.dll with the one provided.

Cheers!

Merge double post
Source? License? Why not just rework the existing FAR plugin?

<moderator voice>Without source and license I'm afraid we'll have no choice but to remove the link. However, as you're obviously very new here (welcome to the forums! And contributing already, nice!) I'll give you a chance to do that rather than immediately yanking it.</moderator voice>

This is an interesting idea, although I'm not sure of the use case--is this for launching TWR=3 rockets from Eve? As with a normal launch from Kerbin, you're unlikely to ever hit terminal velocity.

What would be *really* useful for FAR-MJ interaction, however, is an autopilot that flew an *actual* gravity turn, not the based-on-altitude pitch program Ascent Guidance uses.

What would be *really* useful for FAR-MJ interaction, however, is an autopilot that flew an *actual* gravity turn, not the based-on-altitude pitch program Ascent Guidance uses.

Although that would kill all the fun programming ascent guidance for FAR\NEAR

Still no sourcecode nor license after a month of the previous warning.

God knows what I'd like to see is MJ be able to reasonably predict a landing target with FAR/NEAR installed. So far as I can see the only way is to quicksave and trial and error.
